description:
The gTech Knowledge, Infrastructure and Tools (gKIT) team’s mission is to drive and optimize one ads support ecosystem. The Ads Content Strategy Team (ACS) is a key focus area within gKIT and fully dedicated to creating and curating quality ads help center content experiences globally that educate and empower our advertisers and agents alike.

As an Ads Content Analyst, you’ll be responsible for maintaining and developing reporting systems, data analysis, and visualizations to shape our content strategy and optimize workflows.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of solution-oriented trusted advisors support millions of customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience with JavaScript and SQL.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in a web or data analytics role.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage numerous projects concurrently.
  • Developed communication and collaboration skills.
  • Demonstrated problem-solving, critical thinking and analytical skills.
responsibilities:
• Provide weekly editorial operations reporting.
  • Create and maintain reports and dashboards to support content workflows and initiatives.
  • Maintain and optimize content request system.
  • Support writers with data analysis to inform content development and project work. Manage multiple analytics projects and ad-hoc requests with great flexibility.
  • Develop quantitative and qualitative methods to come up with actionable insights that will help us maintain a high-quality content set and measure the impact of our work.
title: Ads Content Analyst, gTech Users and Products
